Race.SpecificTitle: Chief of Police -- Town of Livingston
PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within Livingston Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a five (5) mill ad valorem tax for a period of ten (10) years for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining roads and bridges within the parish.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 26(B) of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a five (5) mill ad valorem tax (an estimated $12,300,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) ("the Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining roads and bridges within the Parish; and shall the Parish be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds from time to time for any of said capital improvements, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana, including Sub Part F, Part III, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-Mosquito Abatement Dist. -- 3 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition 
(Mosquito Abatement District)

Summary:  Authorization for the Livingston Parish Mosquito Abatement District, Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana, to levy and collect a three (3) mill ad valorem tax for a period of ten (10) years for the purpose of paying costs of mosquito abatement programs for the citizens of Livingston Parish through the Livingston Parish Mosquito Abatement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the Livingston Parish Mosquito Abatement District, Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect a three (3) mill tax on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $1,267,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning in the year 2014 and ending in the year 2023, for the purpose of paying costs of mosquito abatement programs for the citizens of Livingston Parish through the Livingston Parish Mosquito Abatement District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 7 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a ten (10) mill tax on assessed valuation of all property subject to taxation in Fire Protection District No. 7 of Livingston Parish, Louisiana, for a period of ten (10) years for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and for purchasing fire trucks and other fire-fighting equipment.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 7 of Livingston Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, as amended, La. R.S. 40:1501 and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a tax of ten (10) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $49,800.00 is reasonably expected to be collected for an entire year) for an additional period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and for purchasing fire trucks and other fire-fighting equipment?
